message.content:
If you are looking for a recipe that uses cornmeal and blueberries, we suggest trying out Blueberry Cornbread. Here is an easy recipe for you:

Ingredients:
- 1 cup yellow cornmeal
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2/3 cup granulated sugar
- 3 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 cup milk (whole milk or buttermilk is best)
- 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled (or use vegetable oil)
- Zest of one lemon (optional, but adds a nice flavor boost)
_ Note: if using something sweetened like almond milk replace the quantity of sugar.
 
Instructions:
Preheat oven to around Gas mark6.

Grease an aluminium pan with either butter or margarine.

In a mixing bowl mix cornmeal, flour,sugar,baking powder and zest from half a lemon.Stir it well so as to avoid any clumps.For extra fragrance add vanilla essence Mix in the jug full of liquid ingredients like eggs,melted unsalted better while stirring slowly so as not to cause rubbery texture.Now combine the wet mixture with your dry ones until they form batter.Lastly fold overripe mashed berries into the brims.Give each ingredient some time after adding another respectively.If needed too add more butter.Bake till its crust less then.Lightly greasing bottom will allow edges to rest when swiped underneath.Serve warm.Allow at least six minutes on counterspace befoe removing.Replace ripe bananas alternately.whisk.Though not fit fo eating taste test is encouraged.Instead maybe try whipped cream.The face tends how people feel about whom receiving.Yummy substitutions ideas.Update back soon.Type works
